name: Marvel 1st Appearences Trivia Game | Marvel Comics | 10 Questions

questions.text: What comic did the villian Sabretooth first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"Iron Fist #14 (Aug. 1977)"

	Created by writer Chris Claremont and artist/co-writer John Byrne he appeared in a story arc called "Snowfire". Since, he has been known as the arch enemy of the famed hero Wolverine. While featured in multiple books he has also appeared in his own comics.

questions.text: What comic did the hero Nova first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"Nova #1 (Sep. 1976)"

	The character was created by Marv Wolfman and John Buscema and series lasted 25 issues. "Marvel Comics" has also made three Nova series since then. He has also appeared in books such as "The New Warriors" series and the "Annihilation" storyline.

questions.text: What comic did the villian Apocalypse make his first full appearence?
questions.explanation:
"X-Factor #6 (July 1986)".

	Apocalypse was created by writer Louise Simonson and artist Jackson Guice in '86. Since then Apocalypse has been a major part of the "X-Men" franchise. Including the "Age of Apocalypse" story arc, where Apocalypse reigns supreme.

questions.text: What comic did the hero Man-Thing first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"Savage Tales #1 (May 1971)".

	This character was created by writers Stan Lee, Roy Thomas, and Gerry Conway and artist Gray Morrow. He went on to have multiple series and had a SciFi TV-movie in 2005.

questions.text: What comic did the "Merc with a Mouth", Deadpool, first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"New Mutants #98 (Feb. 1991)"

	Created by artist Rob Liefeld and writer Fabian Nicieza Deadpool is known for being the smart mouthed mercenary who is the only character that seems to be aware that he is in a comic book.

questions.text: What comic did Wild Child make his first full appearence?
questions.explanation:
"Alpha Flight #11 (June 1983)".

	He was created by John Byrne and has been potrayed as either a hero or a villian under different aliases. He is most seen in the comics "Alpha Flight", "X-Factor", and "Weapon X". In the "Age of Apocalypse" storyline he is seen as the sidekick to Sabretooth.

questions.text: What comic did the hero Wonder Man first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"The Avengers #9 (Oct. 1964)"

	Wonder Man was created by writer Stan Lee and artist Jack Kirby and is a long time member of "The Avengers". Usually seen on the "West Coast Avengers", and is paired up with his longtime friend Beast.

questions.text: What comic did the villian Unus the Untouchable first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"X-Men #8 (Nov. 1964)"

	Created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby Unus is as his name says, he has a force field generation that makes him untouchable. Over the years he has fought heroes such as the X-men, Spider-man, and the Hulk. He has even said to have died twice both by lack of oxygen.

questions.text: What comic did Spider-Girl first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"What If... #105 (Feb. 1998)"

	Created by Tom DeFalco and Ron Frenz she is obviously a spin-off of one of Marvels most popular heroes, Spider-man. Created as just a "What If..." comic she got her own multiple comic book series.

questions.text: What comic did Silver Samurai first appear in?
questions.explanation:
"Daredevil #111 (July 1974)".

	This character was created by Steve Gerber and Bob Brown. Silver Samurai is a mutant who is frecuently seen with the X-men. But has had confrontation with other heroes, and villians.
